title: Print, "Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of Asia", 1740
inscribed: On plate, upper left: c; upper right: 9; lower left: De la joue in.; lower right: huquier Sculp. et ex. C.P.R.; on sheet, upper right: 18; lower right: 9
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: An asymmetrical cartouche with elements that refer to the continent of Asia: half-view of a camel (at right), a turban, and a steaming casserole pot. Around the river of the cartouche are clusters of leaves and fruits.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of Asia", 1740.
1740. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-326-18.
